result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard A. Wylie

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard A. Wylie in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Richard A. Wylie in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances.  Also has 15 CF 96 & 15 CM 92.  Atty McL offers a plea questionaire and waiver of rights form.  Court questions Mr. Wylie re: the plea questionaire and waiver of rights form. Court finds the def. freely and knowingly waives his rights. Court finds there is a factual basis. 

15 CF 12
Count 1-Def. pleas no contest. Court accepts plea and finds the def. guilty.
Count 2-Dismissed but read-in. 

15 CF 96--Dismissed but read-in. on State's Motion

15 CM 92--Dismissed but read-in.

Court orders a PSI in 15 CF 12  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Attorney James C. McLaughlin in court.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and appearances. Also has 15 CF 96, 15 CM 92.  No appearance by def.  Atty McL speaks to the court.  Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant, Richard A. Wylie appeared with Attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Attorney Thomas H Frost appeared for the State.  Court calls case and appearances.  Also has 15 CM 92 and 15 CF 12.  Def. waives the preliminary exam.   Court finds that the def. freely and knowingly waives his right to a preliminary exam. Court finds there is probable cause that the def. committed a felony.

Status conference at 08-10-2015 09:15 am.
Status conference at 10-05-2015 11:15 am.

Defendant Richard A. Wylie in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Richard A. Wylie in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:31 am Court recites cases 15 CF 12, 15 CF 96, 15 CM 92 & app; DA calls Officer D. Ricci - sworn & testifies, identifies deft, cont'd testimony; Atty McL - cross; DA - nothing; witness excused; DA rests; Atty McL - nothing; DA - statement; Atty McL - statement; Court finds prob cause, bound over; DA tenders Info to court - Court recites cts; Atty McL - waives reading, NG plea; Court - subst Aug 28, def motions 10/2, Status Oct 5 at 11:15 am.  
15 CF 96 - rec'd copy of complaint, waives reading, prelim set for 8/10 at 9:15 am.  15 CM 92 track w/both CF files.  Bail cont.  Adj'd 11:40 a.m.  Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Richard A. Wylie in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Defendant Richard A. Wylie in custody.  Thomas H Frost appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint received, waives reading. 2 files - 15CF12. CM - not guilty plea entered.  McLaughlin requests bail modification. CF file had Initial in Feb w/warrant.  McLaughlin makes statement - req signature bond for DE to attend treatment.  Frost makes statement.  Court - needs prelim.  McL - waive time limits on prelim, requests to be set out 45 days.  status set in CM, prelim set in CF. 7/27/2015 at 1130.  Court - bail modified to signature bond with conditions of treatment.  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 11:30 am.
